meanings.sent1: She tends to misdescribe events when retelling them.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to misdescribe facts in a report.
meanings.sent3: The detective's misdescription of the suspect led to a humorous mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Her painting misdescribed reality in a whimsical way.
meanings.sent5: The student's misdescription of the experiment made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: To give a false or misleading account of.
meanings.sent1: Politicians sometimes misdescribe their opponents' policies.
meanings.sent2: The witness was caught trying to misdescribe the incident.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's misdescription of the movie plot had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her smile misdescribed the sadness in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The map misdescribed the location of the hidden treasure.
